com.avalancheevantage.android.camera3

Interface ErrorHandler


  • public interface ErrorHandler
    An interface to define a way to handle camera errors.

    Because most of the Camera3 code is asynchronous, exceptions can't always be thrown to the user. This interface provides a channel for Camera3 to send error messages back to the caller so that they can be displayed to the user.

    For debugging, you can use Camera3.ERROR_HANDLER_DEFAULT, which just logs everything.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void error(java.lang.String message, java.lang.Exception e)
      Called when a fatal error occurred that definitely prevented the camera form working in a way that is visible to the user.
      void info(java.lang.String message)
      Called throughout the Camera3 code for debugging.
      void warning(java.lang.String message)
      Called when we suspect that the user might have made a mistake or when minor error occurred that might alter the behavior of the camera.

    • Method Detail

      • error

        void error(java.lang.String message,
           @Nullable
           java.lang.Exception e)
        Called when a fatal error occurred that definitely prevented the camera form working in a way that is visible to the user. The end user should be notified gracefully and the camera session might need to be restarted.
        Parameters:
        message - the error message
        e - the Exception that was thrown (if any)

      • warning

        void warning(java.lang.String message)
        Called when we suspect that the user might have made a mistake or when minor error occurred that might alter the behavior of the camera.
        Parameters:
        message - the error message

      • info

        void info(java.lang.String message)
        Called throughout the Camera3 code for debugging. This should probably be ignored.
        Parameters:
        message - the info message
